page.title: 09Dennistoun Festival, 1985
page.content: This year sees the ninth Dennistoun Festival. This was inaugurated to ensure the continuation of the separate identity of Dennistoun and its environs. The founders felt there was a danger of the community being absorbed into surrounding districts. This Festival is truly a community affair. All ages and sexes take part with events which run the gamut from a Bonny Baby Competition to a Pensioners' Concert. In all, there are some thirty events, covering sport, beauty competitions, folk music, pets' competitions, puppetry, disco dancing, Kung Fu and Dragon dancing.A Festival service was held in a local church. Funding came from local sponsors. Local radio and shops helped with advertising.
